content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the acceleration of an object moving in a straight line is given by <math alttext="a, of t, equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator t squared, and denominator 3, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the net change in velocity from time <math alttext="t equals 0.75 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to time <math alttext="t equals 2.25 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts
